ovdesc.p: The Payment Stop table allows all Payment Stop instructions to be recorded. These are input according to the Account to which they relate. All stop instructions for one Account number are maintained on the same record.

Stop Payments can be input for a specific cheque number, for a range of cheque numbers, for an exact amount, for a range of amounts or for a combination of cheque numbers and amounts. When payment stop is marked for an account, then during FT/DC/TT processing system will raise an override.
Stop payment validation is based on the Cheque.Register value in ACCOUNT.PARAMETER.
Stop payment validates the cheque no irrespective of the cheque type given in the payment stop, if the Cheque.Register is set as "No" or Null in ACCOUNT.PARAMETER.
If the Cheque.Register is set as "Yes", then validation will be done for the cheque no along with cheque type.
For example: Cheque No 12345 with cheque type "EC" is stopped for account 19000 then
If the Cheque.Register is set as "No" or Null in ACCOUNT.PARAMETER,
System will raise override during FT/DC/TT processing when the cheque no is entered as 12345 irrespective of cheque type
If the Cheque.Register is set as "Yes",
System will raise override during FT/DC/TT processing only when cheque no 12345 and cheque type is entered as "EC".
Incase the range of cheque number given for stop payment is not issued to that account- a record with the Cheque.type and Account no will be added to CHEQUES.STOPPED file.
The Payment Stop Type and Cheque Type tables must be defined before input can be made to the Payment Stop table.
There is now the facility to produce SWIFT MT112 (Status of a request for Stop Payment of a Cheque) messages from the PAYMENT.STOP application, via Soft Delivery.
This message is used to indicate what actions have been taken in attempting to stop payment of the cheque referred to in the message.
MT112s can only be requested when the RAISE.ACTIVITY field in PAYMENT.STOP Application is set to "Yes", and only one message can be raised at a time.

From R5 onwards, Once PAYMENT.STOP for an account is authorised and then it is reopened in Input mode again, then the informations in the associated set of fields from PAYM.STOP.TYPE to RESERVED.3 will be cleared. This is made to ensure that PAYMENT.STOP$HIS contains informations of these fields which can be used for audit purposes. Hence when any new stop instructions has to be input , any existing multivalue should not be amended and only new multivalue has to be opened at the end for new intrsuctions
